name: 4-chloro-2-methylanisole
Reason: 4-chloro-2-methylanisole has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit we can compare to is anisole, which has a melting point of around 50 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 4-chloro-2-methylanisole will affect its melting point: (2) The chlorine atom introduces a significant dipole moment, which can increase the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to stronger intermolecular interactions; (3) The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, which can add approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume.
